sentence.Network_en: He was appointed Apostolic Administrator of Minsk by Pope John Paul II.
sentence.Network_cn: 他被教皇约翰·保罗二世任命为明斯克区的宗座署理。

sentence.Network_en: He saw his vocation as one of prayer and apostolic work.
sentence.Network_cn: 他认为从事祷告和门徒的工作是他的使命。

sentence.Network_en: He put in for me, with a zeal that was quite apostolic.
sentence.Network_cn: 他还替我祷告了呢, 虔诚得就跟个圣徒一样.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from French apostolique or ecclesiastical Latin apostolicus, from Greek apostolikos, from apostolos (see apostle)

entry.def: Apostolic means belonging or relating to a Christian religious leader, especially the Pope.

example.ex: He was appointed Apostolic Administrator of Minsk by Pope John Paul II.
example.tran: 他被教皇约翰·保罗二世任命为明斯克区的宗座署理。

entry.def: Apostolic means belonging or relating to the early followers of Christ and to their teaching.

example.ex: He saw his vocation as one of prayer and apostolic work.
example.tran: 他认为从事祷告和门徒的工作是他的使命。

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to or deriving from the Apostles or their teachings
2. proceeding from or ordered by or subject to a pope or the papacy regarded as the successor of the Apostles;
